Description.val: This line item funds the modifications to the Adversary aircraft.  The Adversary aircraft are a combination of 43 F-5 Tiger IIs (40 F-5Ns and 3 F-5Fs), and Block 15 F-16 Fighting Falcon (10 F-16As and 4 F-16Bs), and the J85 Engine supporting  the F-5F/N.  The Adversary aircraft provide essential sorties in support of TOPGUN, Fleet Replacement Squadron, Carrier Strike Group, Carrier Air Wing and Unit Deployment Plan training  Both the F-5s and the F-16s are planned to be used as primary Adversary mission through 2025.

Justification.val: FY 2020 funding request reflects ARC-210 program acceleration under OSIP 017-17 as a result of FY 2019 funding increase

ImplementationMethodName.val: Organic Maintenance Facility Hill Air Force Depot:: Installation Name: Falcon UP Kits

Description.val:
This OSIP incorporates the Falcon Up structural enhancement modification in 10 Navy F-16A Adversary aircraft.  The Falcon Up modification is a safety modification that replaces known airframe fatigue sensitive structure.  Incorporation of the Falcon Up kit extends the airframe service life from 3,665  flight hours to 4,250 flight hours  and will extend the service life until approximately 2025.

Development Status/major milestones:  The structural components on the Falcon Up kit have been qualified by the Air Force and approved for Navy use.  No operational testing is required.  A first article test, consisting of nondestructive critical measurements is complete.  A firm fixed price contract for kits have been awarded.  The kits are in production and delivering on time.  The aircraft modification is done as a heel to toe drive in mod at Hill Air Force Depot.

ModificationTitle.val: F-5 System Safety and Sustainability OSIP 017-17

Name.@footnote: Increase in FY 2021 provides other support for Swiss aircraft reconfiguration efforts.
Increase in FY 2020 provides logistic support for ARC 210 retrofit efforts.  Increase beginning in FY 2021 provides logistic support for Swiss aircraft reconfiguration efforts.
Increase in FY 2020 procures support equipment applicable to the ARC 210 retrofit efforts.  Increase in FY 2021 and FY 2022 procures support equipment applicable to the Swiss reconfiguration efforts.

Title.val: F-5 System Safety and Sustainability OSIP 017-17

Name.@footnote: ARC 210 installation will be by depot level field mod team installation
Forty F-5N aircraft have one display, and three F-5F aircraft have 2 displays each (40 + 6 = 46 units).
SACA is a squadron level install
LN 260 display is a squadron level install
Cost element funds initial non-recurring engineering in support of an ECP to modify the F-5 structure.
Cost element funds initial non-recurring engineering in support of the reconfiguration of the 22 Swiss aircraft into the USN configuration.

B Kits Swiss Reconfiguration - Not Installed

Description.val:
This Operational Safety Improvement Program (OSIP) funds modifications to F-5 aircraft to implement safety updates as well as required upgrades to avionic systems for Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) compliance.

This OSIP includes efforts that address modifications to address safety, reliability, structural integrity, mission availability, maintainability, weapon system employment, obsolescence, and Diminishing Manufacturing Source (DMSMS) requirements. Modifications include Airframe, sub-systems, weapon system, and avionics systems. Modifications, particularly to avionic systems, may also be driven by new cyber security requirements.

Initiatives include, but are not limited to: Stability Augmentation Control Assembly (SACA) Obsolescence ECPs, LN-260 Display Upgrades, Integrated ARC 210 Radios, Swiss Aircraft Reconfiguration to USN standard.


DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: 
SACA and LN260 display on schedule to complete in FY 2019. ARC-210 NRE begins in FY 2019 with procurement of Kits scheduled to begin in FY 2020 and installations starting in FY 2021.  Swiss Reconfiguration NRE and kit procurement scheduled to begin in FY 2021 with installations starting in FY 2022.
